meanings.definition: Showing or characterized by straight lines
meanings.sent1: The artist's drawing was very orthoscopic, with all the buildings perfectly straight.
meanings.sent2: The orthoscopic pattern on the wallpaper made the room look more spacious.
meanings.sent3: The orthoscopic fence looked like a ruler had been stretched across the yard.
meanings.sent4: Her orthoscopic haircut gave her a sleek and modern appearance.
meanings.sent5: The orthoscopic design of the building's architecture was both elegant and precise.

meanings.definition: A type of telescope with a straight-line eyepiece
meanings.sent1: The astronomer used an orthoscopic to observe the stars clearly.
meanings.sent2: The orthoscopic allowed him to see distant planets with great detail.
meanings.sent3: The orthoscopic telescope looked like a long tube with a lens at the end.
meanings.sent4: Through the orthoscopic, the moon appeared closer than ever before.
meanings.sent5: The orthoscopic revealed the beauty of the night sky in a whole new way.

meanings.definition: A type of lens used in microscopy for viewing objects in a straight line
meanings.sent1: The scientist adjusted the orthoscopic to focus on the tiny cells.
meanings.sent2: With the orthoscopic, she could see the intricate details of the specimen.
meanings.sent3: The orthoscopic lens made the tiny bug look like a giant straight line.
meanings.sent4: Using the orthoscopic, he discovered a new world within the microscope slide.
meanings.sent5: The orthoscopic lens magnified the image in a clear and precise manner.
